entry.title: Buckley's Chance
entry.summary:
Author: RaspberryDreams1

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 22,502Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 297

Summary: Evan knows that wish babies are extremely rare, the Fae only grant a handful of wishes per year and almost never to single parents. But Evan so desperately wants a family to love that he’s been subconsciously wishing since he was a teenager. Eddie hadn’t thought of wishing for a baby, he had barely heard of wish babies or soulmates, his parents didn’t believe in such things. Eddie desperately wanted a place for him and his son to belong, a family that would accept him without demanding that he change who he was to fit their impossibly unrealistic expectations.

entry.title: Through the Storm
entry.summary:
Author: Myinsane_mind3

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,406Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 0

Summary: Eddie is in El Paso when his phone rings, Buck’s voice on the other end trembling with grief. In that shaky breath, Eddie hears the unthinkable: "Eddie....Bobby is dead...I-I don´t know what to do". The words hit him like a blow, leaving him raw and shaken, but even through his own pain, Eddie knows Buck needs him more than ever. Without hesitation, he leaves El Paso behind, carrying his own sorrow as he rushes to be by Buck’s side. Though Eddie is just as broken, his first instinct is to comfort Buck, to hold steady for him in the storm they’re both caught in. Or: Eddie takes care of Buck and he finally realizes his feelings for him

entry.title: Second Chances
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 80,293Chapters: 12/?Kudos: 24

Summary: Bobby and Athena are just two people trying to put their lives back together while figuring out how to co-parent. What starts as a complicated plan to foster kids in need slowly turns into something much deeper. Through the ups and downs of heartbreak, healing, and raising children who’ve been through so much, they find strength in each other. Over time, their partnership grows into love, and together, they build a story about family, trust, and second chances.

entry.title: Evergrowing
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 72,016Chapters: 12/?Kudos: 12

Summary: Athena and Bobby are learning that parenting doesn’t end when the kids turn eighteen. With three grown children and two still at home, Bobby and Athena find themselves navigating new challenges at every stage of life. Each child carries their own struggles, some spoken and some hidden, but together the family works through the ups and downs with love, patience, and resilience. At the heart of it all, they’re reminded that family is a bond that grows, shifts, and deepens, no matter how old the kids get.

entry.title: The Price of Power
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 68,623Chapters: 11/?Kudos: 10

Summary: Athena Carter and Bobby Nash couldn’t be more different. She’s the disciplined “good girl” with her future mapped out, while he’s the dangerous bad boy with one foot in college and the other in the streets. When their worlds start to collide, what begins as a bitter rivalry quickly sparks into something deeper neither of them can ignore. But falling for Bobby means stepping into a world Athena never imagined, one ruled by loyalty and violence. That tested everything she thought she knew about herself. As sparks turn to fire, Athena must decide if love is worth the risk of losing everything.

entry.title: tender is the night (for a broken heart)
entry.summary:
Author: lightyears

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 22,334Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 3

Summary: It’s such a small thing, and yet Buck feels almost like he’s intruding by catching the moment, seeing it in its quiet intimacy. He glances away, down at his own hands, and thinks rather wistfully, heart clenching something fierce in his chest: I’m never going to get that. And it’s not the first time Buck’s had that thought; probably not even the tenth, or the hundredth. His brain tends to work a mile a minute, which means he’s used to things flitting through, sometimes with impact, sometimes without. Now, though, it catches. Sticks sharp and tacky in his mind. I’m never going to get that, I’m never going to get that, I’m never going to get that. Or: Buck thinks he’s unlovable. (Or or: Buck goes through it.)

entry.title: when did you get hot?
entry.summary:
Author: lauriesamy

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,465Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 85

Summary: Buck manages a few more reps, and Eddie watches intently the whole time. When he goes to place the weight back on the rack with a loud heave, his muscles tensing, Eddie can’t help but blurt out without a second thought, “When did you get hot?”  Buck freezes. He pants and catches Eddie’s eyes again from above. “Uh, excuse me?”  Eddie regrets ever opening his mouth. He runs a shaking hand through his already messed-up hair. “Just– you weren’t this hot before, and now you’re…” he trails off.   Buck sits up on the bench and turns around to face Eddie. “Hot?” he asks, filling in the gaps with a pointed look. A stupid smile grows on his face with that fuck-ass tilted eyebrow. Eddie hates him.  OR: Eddie comes to the sudden realisation that Buck is stupidly hot, and it awakens a whole new side of him Eddie never knew existed.

entry.title: Of Kidnappings, Cherry Red Suckers, Apocalypse Apologies, & a Giant Bag Full of....
entry.summary:
Author: Firefawn

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,568Chapters: 2/12Kudos: 198

Summary: If Buck thought the aftermath of the lawsuit was bad, it had nothing – absolutely nothing – on the Winchesters barreling into his life, finding out the apocalypse was imminent, that his own death was a seal, and a demon hitting on him.He really should have realized that when an angel shows up to stop you from throwing yourself off a bridge, that it isn’t always a good thing.----After the lawsuit, Buck is back at work, hoping to reconcile. Only...it doesn't go as planned. His family hates him and after a lifetime of rejection it's one hit too many. Buck plans his goodbye…only a certain angel stops him, 'borrows' him, hands him the Winchester-patented starter's guide to hunting manual, and gives him purpose again. Too bad that angel was so busy saving Buck, they forgot about the goodbye letters left in the loft.---Buck rubbed at the bridge of his nose tiredly. "I'm pretty sure this is kidnapping."Dean scoffed. Sam shot him a look "Think of it as adult babysitting."Gabriel waggled a bottle of top shelf bourbon from his perch on the TV stand. "With booze!"Right. Buck eyed his new...friend, warily. "Okay, kidnapping adjacent."

entry.title: I Want Your Attention On Me
entry.summary:
Author: nlpiersee

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,177Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 184

Summary: “I get tired of people picking and choosing when to see me as an adult. The kids just see me as me.” “I see you.” Eddie frowned, spinning them around. “You were busy.” Buck pursed his lips when Eddie glared at him. “You broke up with Marisol weeks ago and still haven’t told anyone.” Buck whispered. “I figured you would enjoy socializing with everyone and wanted you to feel included.” “Bullshit.” Eddie said flatly, spinning them around again.  “Fine. Yes.” Buck agreed. “It is bullshit. I’m petty and jealous about having to share you with other people constantly. It pisses me off because I want your attention on me. Like, all the time.” “Better.” Eddie smirked at him. or At the Grant-Nash house, hosting a celebratory a post-hospital wedding party for the new Han family, Buck inadvertently opens a can of worms. Featuring piano music, a meddling Christopher Diaz (in the best way), bonding moments, an accidental kiss, and a confession that ends in a marriage proposal (in a way).

entry.title: Close Enough to Burn
entry.summary:
Author: stormsaurawrites

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,597Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 9

Summary: Eddie Diaz doesn’t notice it at first. The way his chest tightens when Buck throws himself into danger. The way his eyes linger a little too long on Buck’s smile—or worse, on the way his uniform pants fit.Buck, of course, notices nothing. He’s too busy being Buck: all wide grins, reckless bravery, and unwavering loyalty.But with every close call, every brush of shoulders, every laugh that lingers longer than it should, Eddie finds it harder to deny the truth pressing at the edges of his heart.Because somewhere between the firehouse, the late-night beers, and the patching-up after calls… Eddie Diaz is falling in love with his best friend.And Buck has no idea.

  • No Archive Warnings Apply

entry.title: Stop, Drop and Roll (My heart is on fire)
entry.summary:
Author: Salve_El_Atun

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,130Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 25

Summary: Eddie had spent years mistaking smoke for fire —building simulations of love that looked solid on paper but crumbled under the weight of reality. Shannon, Ana, Marisol… Each one a drill, a rehearsal, a story without heat.Until Buck.In the silence of their kitchen, Eddie finally dares to step into the flames and learns what it means to burn for real.
